name: Corey Lawrence
headline: Systems Engineer | Data-Governed Revenue & Marketing Platforms
professional_summary: I design and own data-governed revenue and marketing systems where accuracy, lifecycle clarity, and system trust matter. My background spans software engineering, CRM architecture, and go-to-market operations, which lets me build platforms that connect web, CRM, analytics, and automation into a reliable system of record. I embed governance directly into system design so teams can trust their data, improve attribution, and keep reporting defensible without constant manual cleanup.
core_focus_areas: Canonical data models and lifecycle design

capability_clusters.summary: Builds governed data models, validation, and ownership rules so teams can trust the system of record.
evidence: Designed and enforced canonical data models for property and content data using required fields, controlled types, and schema validation.
Embedded field-level definitions and examples directly into the CMS to clarify meaning and expected input.
Implemented intake and build-time validation to prevent incomplete or invalid records from publishing.
Implemented role-based permissions separating content editing, schema control, and administrative access.
Enabled full content revision history through the CMS with visibility into who changed what and when.

capability_clusters.summary: Connects web, CRM, and lifecycle stages into reliable handoffs and attribution flows.
evidence: Owned CRM cleanup, deduplication, and required field enforcement to restore data trust.
Aligned sales and marketing on data definitions and lifecycle stages.
Implemented web to CRM tracking and form ingestion aligned to lifecycle stages.
Designed the flow that connects web engagement and form submissions to CRM records.
Built automation that reduces manual correction.

capability_clusters.summary: Brings hands-on marketing execution with the technology foundations that make attribution, SEO, and campaigns reliable.
evidence: Rebuilt site structure around intent clusters, cleaned up index bloat, and aligned metadata with how people searched rather than how the business described itself.
Ran paid campaigns that produced measurable results by refining keyword strategy, landing page alignment, negative keyword filters, and call tracking.
Led a full web redesign with SEO and paid ad strategy, increasing online revenue by 400%.
Centralized control of third party tracking and analytics scripts.
Created reporting that gave leaders clarity instead of noise.

capability_clusters.summary: Owns end-to-end platform delivery across frontend, CMS, automation, and CI/CD.
evidence: Rebuilt Ashton Gray's website using Eleventy, Sanity CMS, and modular design principles.
Built automated pipelines that export structured content into deterministic Eleventy builds.
Developed React interfaces for reviewing AI generated transcripts and audio.
Designed and implemented a RAG-powered resume chat assistant using structured resume JSON as a governed knowledge base.
Built a full-stack airline operations simulation platform with a Python backend and web interface.

applied_examples: Structured CMS schemas with enforced metadata
Web form to CRM lifecycle mapping

resume_bullets: Designed and enforced canonical data models for property and content data using required fields, controlled types, and schema validation.
Standardized field formats and constraints to ensure consistent data across CMS, site builds, and downstream use.
scorecard.story: I built the CMS so properties and content could not be entered freely. Every required field had a defined format and validation, which meant the site only ever consumed consistent, predictable data and never broke due to bad inputs.

resume_bullets: Embedded field-level definitions and examples directly into the CMS to clarify meaning and expected input.
Created internal user documentation explaining content structure, field purpose, and proper usage.
scorecard.story: Instead of relying on tribal knowledge, I put definitions where people actually work. Editors always knew what belonged in a field because the rules and examples were built into the system itself.

scorecard.category: Source of Truth and Decision Authority
resume_bullets: Established the CMS as the authoritative source of truth for site content with clear ownership and approval rules.
Implemented draft and publish workflows to control when and how content changes reached production.
scorecard.story: Marketing owned site content, editors could update values, and only approved drafts could publish. When conflicts came up, the system enforced authority instead of ad hoc overrides.

resume_bullets: Implemented intake and build-time validation to prevent incomplete or invalid records from publishing.
Added clear error messaging and QA guidance to help users correct issues at the point of entry.
scorecard.story: Bad data never made it into production. If required fields were missing or formatted incorrectly, the build failed or the record was excluded, which shifted quality control from cleanup to prevention.

resume_bullets: Implemented role-based permissions separating content editing, schema control, and administrative access.
Restricted high-risk actions such as schema changes and account management to designated roles.
scorecard.story: Not everyone could change the rules of the system. Editors edited content, marketing approved changes, and only technical leadership could modify structure or account-level settings.

scorecard.category: Data Lineage, Auditability, and Change Tracking
resume_bullets: Enabled full content revision history through the CMS with visibility into who changed what and when.
Maintained auditable deployment history through Git-based version control and automated build pipelines.
scorecard.story: Any public site change could be traced back to a specific CMS edit and a specific code version. If something went wrong, we could see exactly what changed and roll back safely.

scorecard.category: Lead Data Lifecycle and Privacy-Aware Intake
resume_bullets: Implemented privacy-aware lead capture that remained anonymous until explicit user submission.
Defined clear data intake boundaries and ownership handoff to internal stakeholders after submission.
scorecard.story: Behavioral data was collected anonymously and only attached to a lead if the user chose to submit a contact request. I owned intake quality and privacy posture, then handed responsibility to the business once the data left the site.

data_governance_strengths.overall_takeaway: Strongest in data modeling, quality enforcement, metadata, access control, and auditability; credible in lifecycle and retention with ownership properly scoped to the business.

data_governance_artifacts.overview: These artifacts were produced through hands-on ownership of a revenue-critical web and CRM platform. They represent practical data governance embedded directly into system design rather than standalone documentation.

artifacts.name: Canonical Content and Property Data Model
artifacts.description: Defined and implemented the authoritative data model for properties, pages, investor content, and site-wide settings.
implementation: Sanity CMS schemas with explicit field types and relationships
Required fields for core business data
Single definition of a Property entity used across the platform
artifacts.business_value: Ensured consistent structure and meaning of data across web, analytics, and CRM integrations.

artifacts.name: Metadata and Field Standards
artifacts.description: Established required metadata standards to support attribution, analytics, and search discovery.
implementation: Enforced titles, descriptions, slugs, and identifiers at publish time
Prevented incomplete or malformed records from being deployed
artifacts.business_value: Improved trust in reporting and reduced downstream data cleanup.

artifacts.name: Web to CMS to Build Data Lineage
artifacts.description: Defined and enforced how content data moves from creation to consumption.
implementation: Sanity CMS as system of record
Structured JSON exports
Deterministic Eleventy static site builds
artifacts.business_value: Made data flow predictable, explainable, and debuggable.

artifacts.name: Web to CRM Attribution Flow
artifacts.description: Designed the flow that connects web engagement and form submissions to CRM records.
implementation: Form submission mapping to CRM contacts
Preservation of tracking and context metadata
Alignment with CRM lifecycle stages
artifacts.business_value: Enabled meaningful attribution and clearer handoff between marketing and sales.

artifacts.name: Lifecycle Safe Content Publishing Process
artifacts.description: Established lifecycle rules for how content is drafted, published, updated, and propagated.
implementation: Draft and publish states enforced in CMS
Automated rebuilds triggered by content changes
Consistent propagation of updates across dependent pages
artifacts.business_value: Reduced risk of stale or inconsistent data appearing across the platform.

artifacts.name: Role Based CMS Access Model
artifacts.description: Separated content editing from system architecture to reduce operational risk.
implementation: Editors limited to governed fields
Schema and structural changes owned centrally
Clear system ownership boundaries
artifacts.business_value: Protected data integrity while enabling non-technical teams to operate independently.

artifacts.name: Tracking Script Governance Framework
artifacts.description: Centralized control of third party tracking and analytics scripts.
implementation: CMS controlled injection of GTM, HubSpot, and other scripts
Explicit header and footer placement rules
artifacts.business_value: Reduced risk of broken analytics and undocumented tracking changes.

artifacts.name: Attribution Ready Analytics Foundation
artifacts.description: Prepared structured data and tracking foundations to support reliable analytics.
implementation: Consistent page and property identifiers
Session, scroll depth, and engagement tracking
Structured data for search engines and AI crawlers
artifacts.business_value: Improved confidence in analytics and downstream reporting.

artifacts.name: Automated Build and Deployment Controls
artifacts.description: Removed manual steps from deployment and content propagation.
implementation: Content triggered builds
Partial rebuild logic for changed content only
Versioned CI/CD pipelines
artifacts.business_value: Increased reliability, reduced human error, and supported safe scaling.

marketing_summary.overview: 10 years of marketing experience, including eight years at Highland International where I moved from specialist to manager to head of marketing. I built the marketing systems and the underlying data foundations, then saw firsthand how broken data undermines attribution and decision-making. That experience now informs how I design revenue systems, data models, and automation so teams can trust the numbers.

experience_depth.full_funnel: I learned how to run the entire lifecycle of demand generation. I conducted customer research, developed messaging based on real objections, built campaigns that targeted each awareness stage, and connected everything to sales outcomes. I have created SEO strategies, paid search structures, landing pages, email nurture paths, and analytics dashboards that tracked progress from interest to revenue.
experience_depth.seo_and_content: I rebuilt site structure around intent clusters, cleaned up index bloat, and aligned metadata with how people searched rather than how the business described itself. I created anchor content that drew traffic from national competitors and used internal linking and page authority to lift entire product lines in search. That work tripled organic traffic and created steady compounding gains.
experience_depth.paid_search: I ran paid campaigns that produced measurable results instead of vanity traffic. I refined keyword strategy, developed landing page alignment, reduced wasted spend through negative keyword filters, and used call tracking to confirm attribution. I paused campaigns that brought leads but not pipeline and focused budget where outcomes proved themselves. This doubled qualified leads while reducing cost per conversion.
experience_depth.product_launches: I launched multiple products from concept to revenue. I did the market research, messaging strategy, label design, sales collateral, online positioning, and distributor enablement. That experience taught me how to align marketing, product, and sales so that the story, offer, and delivery were unified.
experience_depth.content_strategy: I wrote copy, guides, articles, landing pages, email sequences, and collateral that supported real sales conversations. I tested headlines, structure, and tone until the market confirmed what worked. I learned what makes someone click and what makes them buy.
experience_depth.cross_functional_alignment: I worked directly with leadership to tie campaigns to revenue goals. I partnered with sales teams to understand objections and built materials that supported those conversations. I created reporting that gave leaders clarity instead of noise. This taught me how to move teams from ideas to execution.

marketing_summary.how_it_connects_to_my_tech_work: My marketing foundation lets me build revenue systems that reflect real buyer and sales workflows. I understand what needs to happen between a campaign and a closed deal, so I design web, CRM, analytics, and automation with clear ownership boundaries and reliable data flow.

key_metrics.online_revenue: From 50K to more than 250K per year
key_metrics.qualified_leads: Doubled through paid and organic improvements

rev_ops_fit.summary: I'm a strong fit for RevOps and revenue systems ownership because I bridge engineering, CRM architecture, and go-to-market operations. I design canonical data models, enforce lifecycle rules, and build automation that prevents bad data instead of cleaning it up later.

breakdown.revenue_engine_context: I understand revenue teams because I've owned the CRM and the funnel. Ten years in marketing means I know how attribution, lifecycle stages, and handoffs actually work and where they break.
breakdown.systems_thinking: I treat RevOps as a system-of-record problem: define canonical entities, enforce required fields, and design ownership boundaries so data stays trustworthy.
breakdown.technical_execution: I build the pipelines: CMS schemas, API integrations, web-to-CRM tracking, validation logic, and CI/CD that keeps data flow deterministic.
breakdown.enablement_and_adoption: I bake governance into the tools people use through field definitions, guardrails, and feedback at the point of entry so adoption is natural and cleanup is rare.

rev_ops_fit.value_statement: I design revenue systems teams can trust, operate, and scale without constant manual cleanup.
rev_ops_fit.strategic_impact: For growing companies, I reduce attribution ambiguity, improve CRM integrity, and make reporting defensible by aligning web, CRM, analytics, and automation to a single system of record.

revops_positioning.value_statement: I design revenue systems that teams can trust, operate, and scale without constant intervention.

situation.initial_platform: WordPress-based one-page marketing site with basic blogging
limitations: Mostly copy edits and blog posts

task.objective: Transform a one-page marketing site into a scalable web platform that meaningfully expands the company's digital footprint.
responsibilities: Advise leadership on structure and presentation

platform_expansion: Replaced the single-page structure with a multi-page platform
Built dedicated pages for every individual property
Implemented a property listings page for browsing and search
technical_execution: Moved beyond WordPress constraints into a more flexible architecture
Designed a canonical property and content data model with required fields and relationships
Ensured consistent metadata and identifiers across pages for reliable analytics and CRM use
leadership_involvement: Acted as subject matter expert for web and technology
Advised on site structure, marketing direction, and presentation
Communicated decisions clearly with founders and executives

outcomes: Significantly expanded the company's web presence
Enabled scalable property and content publishing
Reduced reliance on manual, fragile updates

reasonable_current_state_metrics.page_count: Dozens of indexed pages instead of one

situation.problem: No clear visibility into who was visiting the website or how web activity tied back to prospects.

task.objective: Integrate CRM tracking to support attribution and prospect-level insight.

crm_integration: Integrated HubSpot CRM into the website
Enabled user-level tracking for known prospects
Connected website activity to CRM records
Preserved tracking and context metadata on form submissions
Aligned form mapping with CRM lifecycle stages
attribution_support: Allowed visibility into which prospects were visiting the site
Improved ability to connect web engagement to sales activity

outcomes: Stronger connection between marketing activity and sales follow-up

problem_state: Sales reps lacked confidence in CRM data

task.objective: Restore CRM trust so sales could rely on data for execution and reporting.

sales_alignment: Aligned on what accurate data meant
Reinforced CRM usage as a system of record

outcomes: Sales reps felt confident using the system

previous_process: Reps manually copied CRM data into Google Maps
No confidence they were prioritizing the right stops

task.objective: Make route planning fast, accurate, and low-effort for sales reps.

problem: High volume of unqualified inbound leads

task.objective: Define and focus on leads that matched the company's industrial product offering.

qualification_definition: Defined qualified leads as those needing industrial-grade materials
alignment: Aligned marketing efforts with what sales could actually sell

outcomes: Better alignment between marketing and sales

problem: Duplicate records caused sales to be split across contacts

task.objective: Make reporting meaningful by fixing underlying data integrity.

outcomes: Leadership could make decisions based on data

revops_and_platform_stories.role: Marketing Specialist to Head of Marketing

situation.challenge: Need to improve organic visibility and content structure without heavy engineering resources

task.objective: Improve SEO and content performance through structured execution.

outcomes: Organic traffic increased by roughly 300 percent
Content became easier to manage and scale

experience_summary: Over 100 projects delivered across revenue systems, web platforms, and marketing operations. I combine GTM context with hands-on engineering to build data-governed systems that reduce risk, increase clarity, and support reliable revenue decisions.
unique_value: Lots of people can run campaigns and lots of people can write code. Very few can connect engineering, CRM architecture, and go-to-market operations well enough to build systems of record teams can actually trust. That is where I am strongest.

featured_systems_work.name: RAG Powered Resume and Portfolio Assistant
featured_systems_work.description: Client side retrieval system using structured resume JSON as a governed knowledge base.

featured_systems_work.name: Commercial Real Estate Web Platform
featured_systems_work.description: CMS driven platform with enforced schemas, CRM tracking, and automated deployment.

featured_projects.name: Portfolio Chat Assistant
featured_projects.subtitle: RAG-Powered Resume Chatbot
featured_projects.description: The interactive chat application you are using right now. It serves as a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) interface for my resume, using structured resume JSON as a governed knowledge base so answers stay grounded. Designed and implemented entirely by me to demonstrate practical AI integration.
key_features: Client-side RAG architecture using the resume JSON as a dynamic knowledge base.
Real-time integration with Google's Gemini AI for natural language understanding and response generation.
Context-aware conversation history for seamless follow-up questions.
Streaming responses with markdown rendering and auto-scrolling.
Dynamic prompt engineering to enforce factual accuracy and third-person tone.
technical_highlights: Implemented using the Google Generative AI SDK directly in the browser.
Custom prompt construction logic to map user queries to resume sections.
Responsive design with mobile-friendly navigation and animations.
Zero-backend architecture; runs entirely client-side for speed and privacy.

featured_projects.name: Comfort Airlines Aircraft Simulator
featured_projects.subtitle: Full-Stack Airline Operations Simulation Platform
featured_projects.description: A comprehensive simulation platform that models airline operations over a two week period, combining a robust Python backend for flight, aircraft, and passenger scheduling with a user friendly web interface for visualization and interaction. Designed for educational and analytical exploration of airline logistics, profitability, and operational strategy.
key_features: Backend simulation engine models flights, aircraft, passengers, and finances, generating detailed CSV reports.
Frontend web interface (HTML, JS, CSS) for dashboards, ticketing, and interactive visualizations.
Intuitive GUI for ticket purchasing, dashboards, timetables, and aircraft activity playback.
Playback controls for financial and operational reports, enabling users to see profit and activity over time.
Simulation of 400,597 passengers and 3,475 flights, achieving $263M+ net profit in two simulated weeks.
technical_highlights: Python backend with modular simulation, scheduling, and reporting logic.
Detailed algorithm documentation and modular codebase for extensibility.
Frontend built with vanilla JS, HTML, and CSS for broad compatibility.
Interactive map and dashboards for visualizing simulation results.
Granular CSV reporting for aircraft, airports, flights, passengers, and financials.
featured_projects.impact: Delivered an accessible, end to end simulation and visualization tool for exploring the complexities of airline operations, from scheduling and logistics to financial outcomes. The project demonstrates full stack development, automation, and the ability to translate complex business logic into an engaging, educational platform.

featured_projects.overview: Led the complete rebuild of Ashton Gray's corporate website, transforming it from static files into a modern, CMS driven platform powered by Sanity, Eleventy, and GitHub Actions. Delivered a fully automated, SEO optimized, and highly performant site designed for scalability, ease of content management, and polished user experience.
key_achievements: Designed and implemented a scalable content model in Sanity CMS, including schemas for properties, homepage, team members, site settings, and investor pages.
Built a dynamic static site pipeline with Eleventy and Nunjucks, generating fully SEO optimized, crawlable pages for every property and core site section.
Developed Node.js automation scripts for content export, image and video caching, and smart rebuild logic that only regenerates changed pages.
Implemented GitHub Actions workflows for both fast builds (content only updates) and full builds (complete site rebuild), connected directly to Sanity webhooks for automatic deployment.
Created a robust property media system supporting both images and videos in carousels with auto play and responsive handling.
Optimized website performance and Core Web Vitals (FCP 0.7s, LCP 1.1s, TBT 110ms, CLS 0.047, Speed Index 1.1s) achieving Lighthouse scores of 98 Performance, 93 Accessibility, and 100 SEO.
Developed an advanced Property Contact Modal with full validation, session aware form handling, smooth animations, and direct URL parameter access (?contact=true).
Built a Smart Return to Map feature with state caching so users can browse properties, view details, and return to their previous map view seamlessly.
Implemented custom User Metrics system with session management, IP based geolocation, scroll depth tracking, file download tracking, and form analytics.
Developed a full featured Investors Page with interactive charts (Chart.js), animated demographic wave charts, returns calculators, and an interactive property portfolio map.
Refined dropdown menus with GSAP animations and integrated them across mobile and desktop for category based navigation.
Improved accessibility and responsiveness across all site sections, including modals, carousels, headers, and footers.

Integrated dynamic tracking script management in Sanity CMS, enabling client control over Google Tag Manager, LinkedIn, HubSpot, and other third party scripts with header and footer placement options.
Added automated SEO tools: sitemap generator, JSON LD structured data for RealEstateListing schema, and hidden semantic enhancements for search engine indexing.
featured_projects.impact: Delivered a CMS powered website where Ashton Gray's team can independently manage property listings, investor content, team profiles, and tracking scripts without developer intervention. Automated builds reduced deployment time while performance optimizations positioned the site for stronger SEO rankings, smoother user experiences, and better scalability for future growth.

featured_projects.name: Music Player PWA
featured_projects.subtitle: Progressive Web App
featured_projects.description: A Progressive Web App music player that offers efficient audio playback with dynamic song management capabilities. Features intelligent audio preloading based on network connectivity, offline functionality, and integration with device media controls.
key_features: Offline capability - works without internet after initial load
Cross platform installation on iOS and Android devices
Intelligent audio preloading based on network conditions
Integration with Media Session API for native device controls
Dynamic playlist management and audio library organization
Responsive design optimized for both mobile and desktop experiences
technical_highlights: JavaScript for audio management and buffering
Service Worker implementation for offline functionality
PWA architecture following modern web standards
Media Session API integration for system level audio controls
Performance optimization for various network conditions

featured_projects.name: DevolveAI
featured_projects.subtitle: AI-Powered Decompiler
featured_projects.description: An AI supported tool that transforms compiled executables into readable source code through a simple web interface. Makes reverse engineering more accessible to developers by reducing setup friction and guiding users through the process.
key_features: AI assisted decompilation of executable files into readable code
Web based interface accessible from any browser
Refine feature for code language conversion and comment addition
Approachable experience for developers who are new to reverse engineering
Support for multiple programming languages in output
Customizable code formatting and documentation generation
technical_highlights: Integration with Google Gemini AI for code analysis support
Multi language backend supporting Python and PHP
File processing and executable analysis pipeline
Real time AI processing with user friendly feedback
Cross platform web deployment for universal accessibility

featured_projects.name: AdventureAI
featured_projects.subtitle: AI-Powered Adventure Game
featured_projects.description: A choose your own adventure style game powered by AI that creates dynamic storytelling experiences. Built with responsive design and a focus on easy interaction so users can quickly jump into new stories on any device.
key_features: AI generated storytelling with unique narratives each session
12 different adventure settings to shape narrative direction
Shared gameplay database allowing users to explore others' adventures
Responsive design optimized for both mobile and desktop
Light, humorous tone with simple visual presentation
Real time story updates based on player choices
technical_highlights: AI integration for dynamic content generation
Story branching and narrative state management
Database architecture for shared user experiences
Responsive web design with mobile first approach
Performance optimization for real time interactions

Developed and executed integrated marketing strategies in collaboration with company leadership.

Conducted professional product photography and created sales collateral.
Owned multiple products across lifecycle from ideation to sales.

key_responsibilities: Designed and executed Google Ads campaigns, doubling qualified leads through ongoing optimization.
Implemented SEO strategies that improved search rankings and drove consistent traffic growth.
Oversaw the redesign of product labels and marketing materials to enhance brand identity.
Coordinated multi channel campaigns while mentoring newer marketing team members.
Oversaw packaging redesigns and collateral updates for brand consistency.

career.summary: Supported product launches with content, collateral, and campaign execution.
key_responsibilities: Supported day to day marketing operations, including email campaigns, blog content, and social media updates.
Produced product photography and design assets to strengthen online and offline marketing.
Created print collateral such as flyers, brochures, and mailers to support sales efforts.
Maintained website content and implemented keyword driven updates.
Assisted with website maintenance and collaborated on early product rollouts.

career.summary: Built production UI for an AI driven SaaS platform with emphasis on clarity, accuracy, and user trust.

Implemented real time state handling to clearly distinguish system actions.
Worked closely with product and backend teams to ensure UI behavior matched system truth.

career.title: Full-Stack Engineer
career.summary: Owns the rebuild of a revenue-critical web platform with a focus on structured data, CRM integration, and system reliability.
key_responsibilities: Rebuilt Ashton Gray's website using Eleventy, Sanity CMS, and modular design principles.
Designed a governed content and property data model in Sanity with required fields and relationships.
Built automated pipelines that export structured content into deterministic Eleventy builds.
Implemented web to CRM tracking and form ingestion aligned to lifecycle stages.
Embedded attribution ready metadata and structured data for analytics and reporting.
Owned CI/CD pipelines, hosting, and release reliability.
Optimized SEO, caching, and image handling to improve page speed and search rankings.
Collaborated with stakeholders to ensure platform decisions aligned with business goals.
career.proud_of: I am especially proud of this Ashton Gray project because it let me merge my marketing background with my technical skills. I was able to think about brand story, investor needs, and user flow while also owning the architecture, front end, hosting, and automated build systems. It is a clear example of how I connect business goals with practical engineering.

learning_and_growth.industry_trends: I keep up with developments in AI, marketing, and engineering by testing new tools in real workflows and validating what works. I do not chase trends. I apply what is useful.

dream_project.description: A personal dream project would be an AI supported storytelling and learning platform for kids. Users could pick a themed world and become characters in interactive stories that adapt to their interests and pace. Over time it could scale into longer tales with visuals and voice, making storytelling more playful and personal while staying simple for parents to manage.

dream_collaborator.reason: Turing laid the foundation for modern computing. It would be meaningful to walk through how far applied systems, automation, and AI have come, and to see how he might approach building reliable, human centered tools with what we have today.

professional_traits.work_ethic: Treats every project like it matters
professional_traits.problem_solving: Looks for root causes and builds solutions that last
professional_traits.adaptability: Able to join and improve existing systems quickly
professional_traits.innovation: Knows when to introduce new tools and when to keep things simple
professional_traits.mission_alignment: Prefers work that has a point and delivers value
professional_traits.reputation: Reliable, calm under pressure, and trusted to deliver
